content.description: If anyone has seen Seinfeld  you will understand the meaning behind the name. The second meaning is the fact that it took me four ttys over three weeks to get on this thing. Well on the forth try it was still wet and I looked at Loran and said F it IÂ’m going for it. Climb up the low angle slab past a bolt to an overlap. Place gear at the overlap (small stuff). Follow the overlap up and right past another bolt. Then step left pas the last bolt to a bulge get up on top of the bulge buy using a one finger pocket high up(crux) then clip the anchors.
content.protection: Three bolts and some small gear. two bolt anchor
content.location: This is located in the Indian Creak area. When you come up from the trail head its the three bolt climb in front of you.

content.description: Climb the right side of the obvious arete to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
Mud Slide Crack wall. Drive north past Humphrey's Ledge main face. Park by Black Pudding Gulley (blue house with large boulder in yard).  

  Walk past the house and turn left at an obvious property line to the woods. Step left through some boulders and follow orange climbers tape up to the crag. Hike left 50' and look for a series of short cracks (12 Weeks, Rear End Blues).  5 minutes to here. 

  Continue climbers' left to another short and broken cliff band.  Hike upward, the cliff betters in quality and grows in height.  Smear Factor will be the first climb.  Sorry Rob is the right side of the obvious arete past Smear Factor. 

  10 minutes from the car.

content.description: Harder than it looks!  Technical and frictiony climbing.  Place optional (and questionable) finger sized gear off the ground and climb to the first bolt (5.8, a little spicey) or stick clip.  Optional .5 below the overlap.  Crux at overlap using an upside down hold, sustained climbing/crimping to top.  2 bolt rap station after mantle.
content.protection: 3 bolts and optional finger sized gear and optional .5
content.location:
Mud Slide Crack wall. Drive north past Humphrey's Ledge main face. Park by Black Pudding Gulley (blue house with large boulder in yard).  

  Walk past the house and turn left at an obvious property line to the woods. Step left through some boulders and follow orange climbers tape up to the crag. Hike left 50' and look for a series of short cracks (12 Weeks, Rear End Blues).  5 minutes to here. 

  Continue climbers' left to another short and broken cliff band.  Hike upward, the cliff betters in quality and grows in height.  Smear Factor will be the first climb. 

  10 minutes from the car.

content.description:
An excellent, short hand crack.  This route is a great beginner lead.  There's a 2-bolt rap station above the crack.  Lower here or continue up the second half of 12 Weeks (5.8+). 

  12 Weeks and Rear End Blues would be extremely popular if in a different location.
content.location:
Indian Creek Wall. Drive north past Humphrey's Ledge main face. Park by Black Pudding Gulley (blue house with large boulder in yard). Walk past the house and turn left at an obvious property line to the woods. Step left through some boulders and follow orange climbers tape up to the crag. Hike left 50' and look for a series of short cracks. 

  The left of 2 prominent cracks. 

  Approach is 5 minutes!!

content.description: Deceptive.  Make a challenging move off of a small boulder and climb up to a rest on a block.  Clip the third bolt and make frictiony face moves up to the anchor.  Cruxes at first and third bolt.
content.location: Start on a boulder behind a tree toward the right side of the Indian Creek Wall, 15' right of 12 Weeks.

content.description: The climb is on a brown slab tucked up in the gully to the left of the Indian Creek Wall. Climb the slab past 4 bolts to a tree anchor.
content.location:
In the gully left of the Indian Creek Wall. 100' left of the 5.6 crack Rear End Blues. 

  Indian Creek Wall. Drive north past Humphrey's Ledge main face. Park by Black Pudding Gulley (blue house with large boulder in yard). Walk past the house and turn left at an obvious property line to the woods. Step left through some boulders and follow orange climbers tape up to the crag. Hike left 50' and look for a series of short cracks. Real McCoy is on the slab up in the gully 100' left. 

  Humphrey's Hollow.

content.description:
Climb the left side of the obvious arete past 2 bolts.  Step left after the second bolt to a finger crack.  Shares a 2-bolt anchor with Sorry Rob Two Fingers. 

  Named for Troy Barnes, who violently slid through the woods while helping establish the route.
content.location:
Mud Slide Crack wall. Drive north past Humphrey's Ledge main face. Park by Black Pudding Gulley (blue house with large boulder in yard).  

  Walk past the house and turn left at an obvious property line to the woods. Step left through some boulders and follow orange climbers tape up to the crag. Hike left 50' and look for a series of short cracks (12 Weeks, Rear End Blues).  5 minutes to here. 

  Continue climbers' left to another short and broken cliff band.  Hike upward, the cliff betters in quality and grows in height.  Smear Factor will be the first climb.  Mud Slide Crack is the left side of the obvious arete past Smear Factor. 

  10 minutes from the car.

climbs.name: Max's Tight Crack
climbs.fa: Max Lurie, Jason Magness, Chris Magness  8/12

content.description: An incipient crack with perfectly spaced natural protection opportunities.  The crux is the first few moves.
content.protection: Well protected with a few micro and small cams to a .4, a selection of small to medium stoppers.  One bolt protects the last few moves to the  2-bolt anchor.  Walk off or rappel from the top of Rear End Blues Crack.
content.location: Just left of Rear End Blues Crack.

climbs.name: Little Wing
climbs.fa: Jonathan Garlough, James Dickson, Loran Smith, Joshua Corbett

content.description: The climb is located to the right of Black Pudding Gully. Climb a short slab to a ledge. Follow a great sustained steep slab past four bolts and a mild runout to a two bolt anchor shared with Adanedi to the left.
content.location: Humphreys Hollow. Right of Black Pudding Gully

climbs.name: Jason's Little Bumpy Thing
climbs.fa: Jason Magness, Chris Magness, Max Lurie 8/12

content.description: Just left of Max's Tight Crack.  Follow a slight bulgy prow past 4 bolts to a shared 2 bolt anchor.  Crux is climbing past the first 2 bolts.  Harder than it looks.
content.location: Just left of Max's Tight Crack.

content.description: The obvious hands to fist crack.  May only be 5.6 now that it has been thoroughly cleaned on rappel; the climb would get two stars if it were longer.
content.protection: Should take good 3-4" cams.  Rope anchor with rap ring on the tree above the crack.
content.location: Just left of "The Real McCoy" in the Humphrey' Hollow area is an obvious hand and fist crack in a cleaned vertical wall.  Climb it...

climbs.name: Adanedi
climbs.fa: Loran Smith, Jim Dickson, Joshua Corbett, & Jon Garlough

content.description:
Climb the intermittent crack with good protection to the double bolt anchors. 

  Pronounced "ah dah nay dey," the route name is the Cherokee word for "gift," or "to give".  Jim Dickson found and scrubbed the line via rappel, then insisted that Loran Smith take the FA lead when he bumbled up to the cliff after the work was done.
content.protection: Protects well with small/very small cams and small to mid size stoppers.  A 3" cam is also useful.
content.location: In the area called "Humphrey's Hollow" in the Handren guide.  This climb is located about 100 feet left of "Smear Factor" on a large mossy slab with a clean stripe.  A four bolt face climb ascends the right side of the cleaned stripe, and to it's left is the obvious intermittent crack line of Adanedi.

content.description:
Climb a right slanting finger crack past a fixed wire to a tree ledge (9+).  Belay at a tree or step left and climb the face above past horizontals (5.8+).    

  There is a 2 bolt rap station at the tree ledge and a rap station above the 5.8 face. 

  Jen was 12 weeks pregnant at the time.
content.protection: Small to finger sized nuts and cams.
content.location:
Indian Creek Wall.  Drive north past Humphrey's Ledge main face.  Park by Black Pudding Gulley (blue house with large boulder in yard).  Walk past the house and turn left at an obvious property line to the woods.  Step left through some boulders and follow orange climbers tape up to the crag.  Hike left 50' and look for a series of short cracks. 

  The right of 2 prominent cracks. 

  Approach is 5 minutes!!

content.description: The best way to describe this section is a bunch of small crags spread out on the very right side of Humphreys. Fun moderate single pitch climbing, very close to North Conway.
